sense.def:
To walk
pomeni premikati se naprej tako, da postavljamo stopala po tleh drugo pred drugo.

seg.quote: Most children learn to walk when they are about one.
He could walk the streets and fear nothing.

sense.def:
A walk
je hoja, ne pa tek.

seg.quote: He slowed down to a walk.

sense.def:
A walk
je tudi potovanje ali izlet, na katerega gremo peš.

seg.quote: He went out for a long walk.
The station is a three minute walk from the park.

sense.def:
One's walk
je način, kako hodimo.

seg.quote: He came in with his distinctive walk.

sense.def:
To walk someone somewhere
pomeni z nekom nekam iti.

To walk away with something
pomeni nekaj si pribojevati, na primer nagrado;

To walk off with something
pomeni brez dovoljenja vzeti nekaj, kar ni naše;

seg.quote: Who's walked off with my pen?

sense.def:
To walk off with something
pomeni zelo zlahka nekaj pridobiti, na primer nagrado;

seg.quote: She'll walk off with a first class degree.

sense.def:
To walk out of a meeting, performance, or unpleasant situation
pomeni nenadoma oditi s sestanka ali predstave ali pustiti neprijetne okoliščine, navadno zato, da bi pokazali svojo jezo.

seg.quote: Most of the audience walked out after the first half hour.
He walked out of his job.

sense.def:
Kadar delavci
walk out
, začnejo stavkati.

To walk out on someone
pomeni nekoga nenadoma zapustiti.

seg.quote: His girlfriend walked out on him.
